brain_cache.rule: Do not try to fix 'dullness' by rearranging the layout. Instead, apply 'Micro-Styling': replace gray borders with soft shadows, use colored backgrounds for active states instead of just text color, and increase whitespace between elements.
brain_cache.trigger: When the UI is logically correct but feels 'boring' or 'flat'
brain_cache.verification: Remove all borders; if the structure collapses, add background shades or shadows instead of adding the borders back.
brain_cache.red_flag: Interface looks like a wireframe even with colors applied

brain_cache.rule: Apply the 'Alternative Views' pattern immediately. Do not iterate on one design; strictly force yourself to create three distinct variations of the same component (e.g., one 'High Contrast', one 'Card-Based', one 'Minimal') before writing a single line of code.
brain_cache.trigger: Starting with a single component (like a data ribbon) and needing a full UI
brain_cache.verification: You have 3 distinct mockups that share no common visual container styles
brain_cache.red_flag: Staring at a single canvas moving pixels by 10px back and forth

brain_cache.rule: Transform static data displays (like progress bars) into 'Juicy' feedback loops. The element must visually react (pulse, flash, color shift) when data changes to satisfy Core Drive 2 (Development & Accomplishment).
brain_cache.verification: The user feels a sense of 'reward' just by watching the bar fill (e.g., animation curves)
brain_cache.red_flag: Data updates look like a spreadsheet cell changing values

brain_cache.rule: If the 'Data Ribbon' is your core idea, do not relegate it to a header or sidebar. Use the 'Center Stage' pattern where the data visualization dominates the screen and controls are secondary.
brain_cache.trigger: When a specific component is the unique selling point
brain_cache.verification: The component occupies at least 50% of the active viewport
brain_cache.red_flag: The unique feature is hidden inside a generic dashboard grid

brain_cache.rule: Avoid 'coloring in' the UI. Use a neutral background (white/gray) for 60%, a secondary brand color for 30% (headers, active states), and a punchy accent color for 10% (call-to-actions, progress bars).
brain_cache.trigger: When selecting a color palette to remove dullness
brain_cache.verification: Check if the accent color is used for anything *other* than primary actions/data
brain_cache.red_flag: The UI looks like a 'fruit salad' or completely monochrome

brain_cache.rule: XP must be 'Volatile' (unsecured) by default. If HP hits 0 (due to bad habits), a percentage of Unbanked XP is permanently lost.
brain_cache.trigger: Defining the relationship between positive (XP) and negative (HP) loops
brain_cache.verification: User fails to maintain habits -> HP drops to 0 -> User sees 'You died' and XP counter drops.
brain_cache.red_flag: XP is safe forever; user has no fear of HP loss other than a visual badge.

brain_cache.rule: Do not allow linear leveling via XP alone. Levels must be 'Gated' by specific Challenge Events (Bosses). XP only allows you to buy 'Equipment' (buffers/tools) to attempt the Boss.
brain_cache.verification: User has 1000 XP but is still Level 1 because they haven't completed the '15 Pushups in 60s' challenge.
brain_cache.red_flag: User grinds easy tasks (washing dishes) to reach Level 50 without gaining real skill.

brain_cache.rule: To create 'Souls-like Overwhelm', the player's starting HP must be low enough that 2-3 mistakes (bad habits) trigger a 'Death' state.
brain_cache.verification: Calculate: (Max HP / Avg Bad Habit Damage) < 3.
brain_cache.red_flag: User feels 'safe' to skip habits for a week without consequence.

brain_cache.rule: Tasks must have 'Hard Fail' states enforced by the AI. There is no 'partial credit' for Boss tasks. 61 seconds for a 60-second task is a Fail.
brain_cache.verification: User inputs 'I did it in 61 seconds' -> AI responds 'Defeat. Try again.'
brain_cache.red_flag: System awards 'Participation XP' for failed attempts.

brain_cache.rule: HP recovery must not be automatic over time. It must be an active 'Consumable' action purchased with XP or earned via 'Bonfire' tasks (perfect streaks).
brain_cache.verification: User is low on HP and *must* perform a positive action to heal.
